Base camera class.

◆ getDepth()

float rev::Camera::getDepth ( const Vector3 &  position)
virtual

Get depth of an object (world-space) given its position.

Positive is behind camera

Implements rev::AbstractCamera.

◆ LookAtRH()

Matrix4x4g rev::Camera::LookAtRH ( const Vector3 &  eye,
const Vector3 &  target,
const Vector3 &  up 
)
static

Calculate look-at matrix given the eye, target, and up vectors.

Eye is the camera position, target is the point being aimed at, and up is analogous to the vector from your eyes to the top of your head See: https://www.3dgep.com/understanding-the-view-matrix/

◆ namespaceName()

const char* rev::Camera::namespaceName ( ) const
inlineoverridevirtual

The full namespace for this class.

Every subclass should redefine/override this property to return its full namespace. The built in logging methods will use this value for the message category

Reimplemented from rev::Object.

Reimplemented in rev::SceneCamera.

◆ pan()

void rev::Camera::pan ( Vector3 &  target,
const Vector2 &  moveDelta 
)

Pan the camera, i.e., move the target point by a specified delta in screen-space (NDC coordinates)

Note that the specified target will change as a result of this operation

Resize the camera's framebuffer to accomodate the given width and height.

Width and height may be refer to either a widget or texture's dimensions
